bonus.title: Right Stuff
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, an Ace character may spend a Fate point to automatically succeed at an Operate or Survival skill test involving vehicles or living steeds with a number of degrees of success equal to her Agility bonus.

bonus.title: Sure Kill
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, when an Assassin successfully hits with an attack, she may spend a Fate point to inflict additional damage equal to her degrees of success on the attack roll on the first hit the attack inflicts.

bonus.title: Dedicated Healer
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, when a Chirurgeon character fails a test to provide First Aid, she can spend a Fate point to automatically succeed instead with the degrees of success equal to her Intelligence bonus.

bonus.title: Smite the Unholy
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, a Crusader character can also spend a Fate Point to automatically pass a Fear test with a number of degrees of success equal to her Willpower bonus. In addition, whenever she inflicts a hit with a melee attack against a target with the Fear (X) trait, she inflicts X additional damage and counts her weapon's penetration as being X higher.

bonus.title: Move and Shoot
bonus.description: Once per round, after performing a Move action, a Desperado character may perform a single Standard Attack with a Pistol weapon she is currently wielding as a Free Action.

bonus.title: Death to All Who Oppose Me!
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, a Fanatic character may spend a Fate point to count as having the Hatred talent against her current foe for the duration of the encounter. Should she choose to leave combat against a Hated foe in that encounter, however, she gains 1 Insanity point.

bonus.title: Sway the Masses
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, a Hierophant character may spend a Fate point to automatically succeed at a Charm, Command, or Intimidate skill test with a number of degrees of success equal to her Willpower bonus.

bonus.title: Cold Killer
bonus.description: When a Killer inflicts Righteous Fury on a target, they may choose to reroll the Crit Result. The second result stands.

bonus.title: Stare into the Warp
bonus.description: A Mystic character starts the game with the Psyker elite advance. It is recommended that a character who wishes to be a Mystic have a Willpower of at least 35.

bonus.title: Warp Eye
bonus.description: The character starts the game with the Navigator elite advance.

bonus.title: Cleansing Pain
bonus.description: Whenever a Penitent character suffers 1 or more points of damage (after reductions for Toughness bonus and Armour), she gains a +10 bonus to the irst test she makes before the end of her next turn.

bonus.title: Quest for Knowledge
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, a Sage character may spend a Fate point to automatically succeed at a Logic or any Lore skill test with a number of degrees of success equal to her Intelligence bonus.

bonus.title: Nothing Escapes My Sight
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, a Seeker character may spend a Fate point to automatically succeed at an Awareness or Inquiry skill test with a number of degrees of success equal to her Perception bonus.

bonus.title: Expert at Violence
bonus.description: In addition to the normal uses of Fate points, after making a successful attack test, but before determining hits, a Warrior character may spend a Fate point to substitute her Weapon Skill (for melee) or Ballistic Skill (for ranged) bonus for the degrees of success scored on the attack test.
